Great food, great selection of beer, great atmosphere and great outdoor seating. One of my favorites in the Madison area!
Very nice outdoor seating for our first time eating here! Tried to come on a Friday night and it was too busy with an hour wait. Great whiskey selection. Get the Parmesan fries!!!

I come here for the fish tacos every few months, which would be more frequent but I don't live super close by.  Always amazing.  The service can be a little slow (even when not busy), but the consistency of the food makes it worth it.  My husband always tries new things and keeps coming back with me.  Parking can be a pain but again, it's worth it!

A perfect stop for a vegan before (or after) the Mustard Museum.  Best menu in the vicinity.  I enjoyed an icy cold black IPA beer from the long list of regional offerings, a bountiful & delicious salad w/ plenty of avocados & chick peas, and we shared a heaping basket of sweet potato fries with smoky ketchup for the table.  Who could ask for more? The menu also offers veggie chili, a portobello burger, and a veggie burger.
Really cool, laid back vibe. Nice diverse collection of customers. Good food (prime rib sandwich; cheese curds); great selection of beer and liquors. Friendly, efficient service.
Great place to come with the family. The poppers are excellent and the free house Manhattan project is awesome !

All I can say is WOW!  A great eatery for lunch or dinner or drinks after work.  They have an excellent bar with a wide range of beers, wines and scotch and whiskey.  It is located in a historic building in downtown Middleton and it is a major step up from the grease spoon bars located in the area.  The bar area is set up to open up 8 doors to their out door seating area.

Their food ranges from custom apps, to sandwiches, to fresh local beef burgers to custom salads (greens are available as a substitution for fry's at no charge).  I would imagine their menu will grow over time.

I'm for sure hooked on the Free House Pub!

In town for a business trip and went here on the recommendation of a business associate. Wow! What a great meal!! I got there around 6:45pm on a Thursday ... and it took a little time to get a seat. Bar was packed with people! Great selection of beers on tap. I enjoyed a couple different local flavors. I got the Old Standby with the Parmesan Garlic fries on the side. The burger was tremendous and the fries were simply out of this world! Absolutely worth the buck fifty upgrade. The food was tremendous and the prices were reasonable. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone in the area.

Great service, fantastic burgers and sandwiches, fun music choices, and great atmosphere - couldn't ask for a better choice for both food and drinks. The menu stays up-to-date and the staff are both friendly and knowledgable. In the summer months, the patio is the place to be.

The service is usually quick and friendly. It's not a long nor difficult table wait as there's often room in the bar (you can also eat in there easily enough). The beer and whiskey selection is especially pleasing.

This is a classy and cozy pub atmosphere. There are several rooms of different sizes that helps create the ambience. Having smaller spaces helps with overall noise levels too, making this a good choice for a romantic night out. I liked the eclectic beer selection as well as the extensive list of wines and spirits. Being from out of state, I had to go with walleye for dinner, and the Po' Boy sandwich didn't disappoint. A large grilled fillet with Cajun seasoning was topped with slaw and Sriracha aeoli. Yum!

The food here was great!  I had the ABLT sandwich with fries and a side of cheese curds.  The grilled sourdough bread for the sandwich was super tasty.  This place offers indoor and outdoor seating.  I'd definitely recommend trying this place.

Downtown Middleton is a charming small town and an equally charming restaurant. We came after the lunch rush and had our choice of seating.
It was a perfect day to eat outside. Days like this make me rethink living in California or moving to Madison.
The service was spot on and we quickly ordered our food and drinks. We started with the fried cheese curds. Need to start a blog to taste all the fried cheese curds in Wisconsin. These were yummy and gone quickly. They were more chewy then I thought it would be.
I had the buffalo chicken salad... it was quite the heaping pile of greens sprinkled with the buffalo chicken. I felt obliged to dump both ramekins of dressing on my salad but should only used one.
I don't know that the iced tea was fresh brewed ... it tasted a little bit like a powder tea.
But overall, a gorgeous day to be eating outside at the Free House.

Visited for an early weeknight dinner. Long-ish beer list with local and international options. Average food (tried nachos, burger, BLT, and a salad). Okay service. The patio and ability to linger for awhile to laugh and talk was the highlight of the dinner.

Food made this 4 stars. It was nearly 3. Free house struggles with a Very Congested entryway. They allow bar patrons to effectively block any access to the place. It was hard to get on the list because we couldn't get to the hostess stand.

But FOOD.
It's good. It's got a zing of specialness. Not Mind blowing spectacular but Plenty of new tastes to explore.
1. Spicy deviled bacon eggs- I will just make them this way forever now
2. Sweet potato fries- YES. Crispy texture. Finally. If you like sweet potato fries try these.

First impression was good.  The place looks nice and the addition to the building was nicely done.

We stopped for a late lunch.  We ordered a bloody mary and asked for water as well.  We had to remind the waitress twice to bring the water and we were halfway through our meal when it finally arrived.  Not a big deal.

We didn't want a large meal so ordered appetizers.  The Chips and Salsa were mediocre at best.  The guacamole was definitely not home made---more of the variety that comes in the squeeze tube from Sam's Club.  The menu said the chips were home made.  I'm not saying they were lying, but the tri-colored chips sure seemed like any garden variety you could get at Sam's, Costco or any other grocery store.

The cheese quesadilla was better, although the guacamole once again was free of any evidence that it was made on site.  

The drinks were good.  

What disappointed me were two things, one of which will guarantee that a return trip to this restaurant will be delayed until they work out the new restaurant kinks.

First, I went to the mens room.  As the restaurant had been newly renovated, I was surprised to find a smelly, hot and humid mens room that had obviously not been recently cleaned.  They definitely did not renovate the restroom from it's original incarnation when it was the Gallery.  It is a hot and humid Wisconsin day and there are no air conditioning vents in the restroom.  Instead a window is propped open.  It was a smelly, disgusting, hot and humid room.  A few hundred dollars more to what was obviously a costly renovation and they could have freshened it up and run an AC line into the restroom.

Frankly, I wish I wouldn't have gone to the restroom before I ate since it dampened my appetite significantly.

The worst thing though, is something I witnessed after we had paid our bill and were getting ready to leave.  We were seated in the bar area and one of the waiters approached the bar and placed an order for drinks for two women who were seated outside.  One of them ordered a draft beer.   

When the bartender pours the beer, the glass overflowed.  She then picked up the glass with all five finger wrapped around the top of the glass.  This alone is disgusting, unhygienic and goes against all of the basics of germ control.  What happened next was the topper, though.   As I said the beer overflowed on rim and side of the glass.  In front of the waiter and with any customer within eyesight able to see she took the BAR RAG and wiped off the glass and the rim of the glass.  

The potential for cross contamination from the bar rag to the rim of the glass (and the customers lips) creates the possibility for incredible pathogen transmission.  While I am sure this was unintentional, it is nonetheless unconscionable and is reason enough for the health department to intervene with severe sanctions.

As we left, I saw the waiter delivering the tainted glass of beer to an unsuspecting customer.  I couldn't walk by without saying something, so I told the customer what I witnessed.  I hope she demanded a replacement and/or decided to walk down the street to another restaurant.

I hope they get their act together.  It's a good location and has potential.  However, with what I witnessed today and with the disgusting restroom experience, I predict that this recent addition to Middleton's sparse dining scene will be short lived.

Beer selection is always top notch. Food is never a miss. Wife and I got married in that same building years and years ago so this place has a special meaning to us so ... We go often. They also run/own the Hawks Landing Tap Room and we split up our dining out between these 2 places. Both equally phenomenal.
Serious options for a place to sit and serious beer choices make it a solid pick... once I want to eat at and update soon!

The most horrible service ever.  Ordered a pint of beer, charged for a pint of beer, and got a 12oz serving.  The waitress argued with me told me I was wrong as the 12oz glass sat next to another pint.  We still stayed and ordered food....only to be asked later to leave by a different waitress at 4pm because the patio was only for people that ordered food....  Great place if you want trashy cheap service from crabby waitresses who expect a tip just for breathing...

Ordered my burger medium rare, it came with a thin browned outside and cold pink throughout. Medium rare should be a cool - not cold pink center (the middle 50% should be red/pink - this was 95%). 

The food was otherwise good, the service was polite enough but .... weird. The reaction to showing her the burger, before taking a bite of it, was "no, that IS medium rare, next time order medium well." 
Um, no it isn't, would "rare" be just raw meat then, because you couldn't actually cook this any less - and no, there won't be a next time. 
That's just one example, there were other misses that made my whole party just wonder. Just odd.

Came here for the first time yesterday. We were walking around the area and decided to stop in for a beer. All we tried was the beer, so I can't really comment on anything else they serve.

Since the weather was nice, we asked to sit outside, and they very kindly let us do so. Normally, they only let people ordering food sit at the tables outside, but there were quite a few free tables. The service was attentive and very nice. The ambiance was really relaxing and laid back, which I liked a lot. They have an impressive selection of beers on tap, and we were both happy with our beers.

Overall, a nice place to stop by for a beer or drink. I'd love to come back with friends.

Stopped in here for a quick lunch. There is free street parking available. Had no trouble finding a spot at lunchtime on a weekday. We were seated promptly. Service was friendly and quick. The menu is very standard fare with sandwiches, salads, etc. the standout item was the sweet potato fries. The Cobb salad was good but not great. Solid draft list. Very impressive whisky list. The patio seemed nice but we sat inside. Seems to be a very nice place to enjoy a drink and some good food. The area is cute with several restaurants and shops.

Not sure why anyone would knock this place. I went on a Wednesday around 2:00 pm and the place didn't have much going on but that was to be expected. The hostess/waitress welcomed us right away with a smile and friendly attitude. I used to live in Middleton and the first thought that went through my mind was that I wish this place had existed when I lived here. The decor is quite nice and the restaurant is spacious and clean. However, it should be noted that the restaurant seems to be comprised of two separate buildings that were later conjoined with the bar in the middle, which does give it an awkward albeit unique feel.

Anyway, we ordered the jalapeño poppers which we both thought were very spicy but very tasty. They were grilled instead of fried so the jalapeños were fresh and the accompanying dipping sauce was a great compliment to take a little edge off the peppers heat. I had the BBQ burger which had a mound of sliced jalapeños and cheddar on a Colonial bun. I loved it! My GF had the ABLT which according to her was "super good". She got it with the sweet potato fries which she thought were "awesome" and I'd have to agree with her on that. Also the sweet potato fries came with a side of chipotle ketchup and again it was spicy but very good. The theme here was SPICY and it's one of the reasons why we liked it so much.

I will be going back soon!!!
Solid watering hole. Friendly and attentive staff. Local and regional distilleries well represented on the menu. Outside seating to boot. A welcome addition to the neighborhood.

What can I say about one of my Top 5 bars in Madison?

The food is first and foremost amazing. I have ate almost everything on the menu and have only a couple times had something I didn't think was stellar and delicious. I recommend this place to all my friends and they all have such good experiences here. I personally reccomend the Quesadillas, fish tacos, and ABLT.

They have 2 patios; one for just drinks and the other for drinks and dining. Both are relaxing and pleasant to sit in. The place is large and can accommodate large parties at a short notice even. They have 2 bars but the 2nd one is usually only open on weekend nights.

They have a constantly changing quality beer list as well as a great selections of whiskey (whisky). 

The staff cares about good food and good service so I would recommend making a trip here even if you are on the East side of town!

I recently went to the Free House with two friends.  We decided to go there because it was a beautiful early summer day and we wanted to sit outside.  Their patio is amazing and I will definitely be back.

There was a short wait to be seated (which is expected on a Saturday night) and we made ourselves comfortable by the back bar.  There's an awesome little spiral staircase leading up to a secluded and quiet small seating area, so we happily enjoyed their AMAZING selection of German beer up there while we were waiting for our table.

We were sat quicker than we anticipated and were very happy with the menu and the service.  Like others have commented, their fare is the hip Wisconsin bend on American dining similar to what you'd expect at Cooper's or the Great Dane.

We got the garlic parmesan fries for an appetizer.  YUM!  I enjoyed the turkey sandwich and my friends both had burgers.  Our only complaint is that they both requested their burgers to be medium rare and they both were cooked on the "well" side of "medium well".

After dinner, we continued to enjoy the patio and their large selection of excellent beers and cocktails. One of my friends offered me a sip of their old fashioned and it was perfect.  And, when we got our bill, we were all pleasantly surprised  as to how little we had spent.  The price point was definitely below what you'd find at a similar establishment downtown Madison.

Definitely check this place out, especially if you want some great outdoor seating!

It's your typical bar food but done really well! The drink selection is great too. 

I'm trying to eat healthy but sometimes you want a burger, they'll actually let you get a wheat bun and a salad on a delicious burger. Of course there's the unhealthy option too. 

Service is good, they have great outdoor for the summer time. 

I've been numerous times and will gladly be back.

I've been curious about the Free House for a couple of years now because I pass its outside table area almost every day and see scads of happy patrons eating there. I finally got my chance this past weekend when the wife and I took our neighbor out for burgers and decided to give the Free House a try. We got seated immediately on a busy Saturday evening and were lucky enough to nab an outside table on what may have been the best day of the summer so far (temps in the 70s, not a cloud in the sky, etc.). All three of us were hankering for a burger and we all three got their "Old Standby," a basic burger with cheddar cheese and a side of fries. The burger was excellent and the fries traditional and very good. The service was a little on the slow side, which I'll chalk up to a busy Saturday night with immaculate weather. All in all it was a great experience. It scratched our burger itch and left us curious to come back soon and try some of the other items on the menu. Definitely worth a look if you're in the area and hungry!

We came on a Sunday when the weather was nice. We took a patio seat and the place was really nice. They served solid beers including my favorite Kolsch.

Fish tacos were OK. I wish they had a little more spice. Buffalo wrap was OK. I wish it had more spice. The pretzel appetizer was fantastic.

The service was awful. No smiles, no personality, she only checked on us once.

I stopped in for lunch and had the avocado BLT with garlic Parmesan fries. The sandwich was mediocre. There wasn't much bacon and it really lacked seasoning. It was a very average sandwich. The fries were good and you get a lot of them. The garlic aioli was a nice dipping sauce for the fries. 

The decor is very nice. They have a cool outdoor seating area too. The staff was very friendly and the service was prompt.

I've been giving this place a try every 6 months since I attended it's soft opening. I want it to succeed. It's a great location, but the food is bland, drinks pricey, and service in the bar area poor. Example: ordered two imported tap beers, watched the foamy heads disappear as they sat behind the bar for 11 min. My friend finally reached over and grabbed them. That got the bartender's attention. If you go here, I recommend getting a table with a dedicated waitress. You "might" get decent service.

Positives:  The bacon & blue burger with fresh greens and grainy bun for 50 cents more was very tasty;   the beer selection is thoughtful;  the situation and decor is pleasant-breezy-suburban plus aspiring;  the staff are smart, hard-working, sharp people.

Negatives:  Beer prices are kind of high;  the Gulden Draak was great but the Capital Maibock reeked of buttery/skanky uncleaned line - - no way will I go back for a casual and overpriced brew under dubious quality control;  ueber-commercial and pretentious feel to the operation, for better or worse;   you are likely paying for slickness, cool, or posture, not for essential quality (though the kitchen product was very solid).
Fantastic fish fry! Yum! We had the grilled cod, clam chowder and the deviled eggs. Service was quick and the old fashioned was yummy. We will definitely return!

What an adorable set up this place has! Great menu with plenty of meat free options too!  Was just here for lunch with some coworkers and their meals looked just as tasty as mine. Could be a little less over zealous on the soft drinks though. I had taken maybe three sips and they brought me a second glass, so by the end of our meal the table was cluttered with untouched drinks, but I will definitely be coming here after work one day to try some of those beautiful bottles behind the bar!

Been here several times since my first review so I figure it time to update. We still almost always enjoy their bar service. I think we've sat outside twice. We really enjoy their deviled eggs with siracha and bacon. We tried the cheese curds today and they were really tasty, very lightly breaded. The ranch they came with was really delicious. I would steer clear of their jalapeño poppers. They were insanely spicy and inedible. And my husband and I love spicy food. I've made jalapeño popper before and they should be seeded and/or deveined more. Service is always really good, very friendly and they check on you often. My husband really enjoys their large beer selection. He can always find something new he can try. I also like how they change up their cocktail menu and the drinks are usually good and well made. We will keep come back here for drink's and good bar food.

Found this place thru Yelp while traveling to Wisconsin Dells from St Augustine, FL. It did not disappoint, from the incredibly tasty walleye Po'boy to the garlic parm fries to the fantastic beer menu. Highly recommend!

This place was alright. We got the pretzle appetizer, with spicy mustard. I ordered the blt with avacado and my husband ordered the beer cheese burger. Everything was fine, but not out of this world. I would go here again but if it didn't impress me the second time around I probably won't be back.

The food was phenomenal! This is one of my new favorite places outside of Madison. I wish the Friday night fresh fish fry was every night. Everything was reasonably priced and the atmosphere is one to be desired for by couples. The wait time was a little longer than I would have liked, but that's a demonstration of how great the food is.

My friends and I visited on a Saturday night after skiing and we got PLENTY of food!  The nachos, cheese curds, sweet potato fries, burgers, turkey sandwich and Old Fashioned drinks were ALL wonderful!!  It's not a cheap place to eat, but certainly worth the money.  No wait, and the atmosphere is very comfy.

Awesome place, great vibe. Cozy evening atmosphere in downtown Middleton.  I was impressed by the vegetarian choices offered.  Most places offer 1-2 choices, Free House had about 5-6.  That made it worth our trip.  Veggie burgers with sweet potato fries were a great choice.  

Other choices included Tofu wraps, salads, portobello mushroom burgers and veggie chili.  And of course they carry the usual carnivorous choices as well.

This is a cozy pub/restaurant.  I enjoyed the comfortable and simple atmosphere here.  There aren't tons of signs or loud artistic displays, instead it again has a pleasant home feeling.  Since I went here for lunch with friends I didn't explore the menu in detail, but it has a fair amount of selection and everything I saw looked amazing.  Their salads are large and fresh.  I had a ham and Swiss melt which was delightfully toasted, not too greasy and the side of greens were lightly mixed as well.  The service was great - polite, friendly and there just often enough.
